website_summaries.verdict: This engraver carries the Dremel brand name, which means more versatility and interchangeability with other Dremel tools.
pros: Soft comfort grip for better control
Letter and number templates included in kit
Disposable carbide steel point, with an optional diamond bit available
cons: Does not etch plexiglass or glass surfaces very easily

customer_reviews.title: This engraver worked fantastic. I used only one of the included carbide ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to engrave serial numbers on about 70 large steel tools for work. I ordered this and a couple diamond bits because I was worried that the carbide bits (comes with four) might not be hard and tough enough to engrave all the tools. This engraver worked fantastic. I used only one of the included carbide bits to engrave all the tools, and it’s still very sharp. It should provide a long life of engraving. I also tried one of the diamond bits on a couple tool. Worked just as good as the carbide. Happy engraving!
customer_reviews.author: Mike E.

customer_reviews.title: Mark your tools
customer_reviews.text: It seems that I do things backwards. I bought all the other Dremel stuff before getting this. Should of had this years ago when I started buying tools or at least bought one before I started loaning tools out. This Engraver is easy to use and comes with extra tips. Now before someone borrows a tool I put my name on so it has a bettr chance to get returned, If my neighbors read this bring my tools back.
customer_reviews.author: Butch

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME!! I have already engraved on wood three times and looking forward to more.It works perfectly fine.A purchase I don't regret at all it was well worth the $20.
customer_reviews.author: Rosana Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to control. I used it on a lot of work and personal items. From plastic to hardened steel, it engraved beautifully. I work in law enforcement and sometimes things are bound to fall off or get lost in a days work. I used this to mark my mags, cuffs, badges, keys, holsters and flashlights. It’s an affordable investment and I highly recommend it to anyone that wants to personalize anything they own.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Tip: Use a lower setting and work slowly for the best results
customer_reviews.text: It is quite noisy and buzzy in my hands. But I found if I used a lower setting and worked slowly, I'd get much better results. I used this to engrave my racing medals. They're not professional awards, but rather mostly age group awards so I don't mind if the engraving isn't professional. I plan to use this engraver for tools/car parts as well.
customer_reviews.author: ChazTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Ya take the good ya take the bad ya take em both and there ya have
customer_reviews.text: I like that it effectively engraves metal surfaces which is obviously its sole reason for existence. I dislike the the vibrations it shot from my hand to my shoulder to my mouth that shook a filling loose. The sound it creates is reminiscent of the turbo prop engine of a combat loaded C-130 on short takeoff. I had a brief flashback of past airborne operations and immediately locked my feet and knees together out of muscle memory. Oh yeah, my friend borrowed it but brought it back without even turning it on. He said he couldn’t use it because it was too big to grip with one hand. My friend is a Yeti.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my Burgess Vibra Tool that I bought at a garage sale about 30 years ago. It still works by the way. I found the Dremel more comfortable to use and a little quieter than my Burgess. When I bought mine Amazon suggested purchasing a set of grinding bits which I thought odd. This is an impact tool not a rotary tool. I notice Amazon doesn't suggest the grinding bits anymore.
customer_reviews.author: ShrikeRaptor

customer_reviews.title: Great engraver.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It's lighter than our standard Dremel so easier on my hands. I have never engraved before but this makes me look like a pro. I got this to sign my stained glass art pieces with. Over all I think it will do what I need and more. Will be having fun playing with it. Would recommend this to anyone who needs to engrave glass as I have yet to try it on any other materials.
customer_reviews.author: Hylton’s

customer_reviews.title: I wish I would have bought it SOONER!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great investment if you own expensive tools/toys! I wish I would have bought this way sooner before I had my truck broken into and my expensive tool stolen. This engrave gets the job done. It is pretty loud, so simply put on some ear plugs and you will enjoy how peaceful and quite this thing is! Trust me, engrave your toys. A key take away from Toy Story is that even Andy marked his toys!
customer_reviews.author: D Stamp of Approval 👊

customer_reviews.title: I try to engrave plexiglass and it didn't even cut ...
customer_reviews.text: I try to engrave plexiglass and it didn't even cut it it just a little bit and it took forever plus it's too noisy sorry to say this I was lookingforward to it
customer_reviews.author: Donna M. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for engraving
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool. Works for engraving on virtually any surface. We bought to engrave beach stones in memory of a family member to leave in places we travel to. Great for any engraving needs. As with any tool in this class it will be a little loud and cause dust so use in area you can control dust or it doesn't matter if you make a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Dan F.

customer_reviews.title: Zero precision; engraves fine otherwise
customer_reviews.text: This does it's job and seems to do it pretty well. My only gripe (and I do feel it's worth knocking off two stars because I'm anal about things like that) is that the engraver tip movement is not limited to only in and out motions. It will periodically also deflect side to side or up and down, making it impossible to get straight lines or smooth curves with any degree of predictability. So yes, it will do its job in that you can scribe legible characters onto solid surfaces permanently however, I like a little finish quality in things and the end results of this are similar to a toddler writing his name for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Kibbey

customer_reviews.title: No extra bits
customer_reviews.text: The tool works fine but the description and packaging are inaccurate. There were supposed to be four bits and there is only the one attached the unit. Picture on the box even shows the extra bits but there are not in the sealed package. Disappointing to purchase the more expensive version for the extra pieces that this kit apparently doesn’t actually have.
customer_reviews.author: Whl

customer_reviews.title: Workshop quality tool by Dremel - easy to control and comes in protective tube for storage
customer_reviews.text: I put it to work engraving brass keys 15 minutes after it arrived. Worked perfectly. I've used engraving tools like this in an industrial setting and found this one to be a little higher quality and easier to control actually. Solidly built, speed control plus the on off switch. Fits easily in my hand and is easy to control freehand. The kit includes extra points and the stencil as well as a nice clear tube with fitted ends to store it in. I placed my smaller battery powered engraver in the same tube for storage. I'm very pleased especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Practical

customer_reviews.title: Not industrial
customer_reviews.text: The word industrial is a stretch. Works great on plastic, wood, and other softer materials. When it comes to my higher end tools it takes a lot of work to get it to engrave deep enough to notice. Does not work as well as it claims. Also the stencil included is pretty much garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: So I'm not sure why but this thing doesn't write ...
customer_reviews.text: So I'm not sure why but this thing doesn't write very well on most metals. It does fairly well on glass and a lot of other things but metal it just doesn't have the power to be able to engrave. If you want to engrave on any kind of tools absolutely not! This was a little more expensive than the last one that I got and the last one that I got with another make it was much better
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Barbaria

customer_reviews.title: It Works... Loudly... But It Works!
customer_reviews.text: This was a really good price, and worked really well for etching glass and my dog’s names on their tags. I will say that I have used othe Dremel products, and it surprised me how LOUD this one is. I kinda wish it were quieter. That probably sounds silly, but there it is. Works well though! Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: MoMaLa

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hoping to have a dedicated engraving tool instead of using my Dremel with flexshaft. However, after I received it, the Dremel with flexshaft performed much better on wood. If you don't want to spend the money on a Dremel rotary tool to do engraving this may be a satisfactory tool. I, however, am not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: cmplanotx

customer_reviews.title: Can be a bit bulky, but the real issue ...
customer_reviews.text: Can be a bit bulky, but the real issue is the noise. I believed it was going to be something i could use often that people on the other side of the house would complain about the noise.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Boles

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This engraver was to replace on that is -- somewhere -- in our storage unit! I works just like the old one, which worked great. Does what it's supposed to do. I use it on metal and glass and with a bit of practice should serve anyone well. It's nicely made and fits well to hand.
customer_reviews.author: riverguy

customer_reviews.title: Best etcher EVER!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used many etchers as I was in the military aviation field and we have to etch EVERYTHING. This tool is very nice and I wish I would've found it faster! Eats into metal like a champ, assuming you hold it right. Don't press hard into the material, just barely graze it and it will pound into darn near anything. I can write very small into my tools. Don't hesitate in buying this tool.
customer_reviews.author: BHizzle

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I got this to put my husbands initials on his tools. This worked perfectly and the engraving on all his tools has lasted. He is a mechanic so he uses his tools constantly. With others we have tried, the engraving never lasted so this was perfect. This was also extremely easy to use. I did not use the stencils that were provided because it was somewhat difficult to use those. It worked perfectly free hand though.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Good product for an inexpensive price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: ++ Easy to use. ++ Inexpensive Cons: -- Using the stencil is so so. You really need a fine engraving head to use it. You also need to hold or tape it down well when engraving since it will shift on you. -- Loud, but it's an engraver Other thoughts: Not much to say. It's an engraver and does its job well for the price. Dremel makes decent products. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Allan J

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use, like writing with a pen.  VERY loud.
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: It has a tapered grip so you can hold it just like a pen or pencil so it's literally as easy as writing with a pen. Price was cheap. Con: It's VERY loud which is why I bumped it down a star. I use it so rarely I don't care but for someone that might use it more frequently you probably want to get something quieter.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use! I engraved two tiny necklace pendants without stencils and they care out gorgeous!
customer_reviews.author: April Holder

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to mark a few things with my name. Worked well on a Master lock, on an aluminum coffee cup. The noise isn’t bad, and I find it is very easy to hold and use with just a little practice. Very happy with this engraver.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wags

customer_reviews.title: Great for marking tools not so great for detailed work
customer_reviews.text: Very loud. Great for marking tools not so great for detailed work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonismyjam

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: My hands are arthritic and many things are hard to do. But this engraving tool was big enough around for me to hold comfortably. I engraved my 5 cats’ names on the back of their rabies tags.
customer_reviews.author: GrandmaC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hand tool engraver!
customer_reviews.text: This worked excellent for putting my initials into my hand tools and I have a lot of hand tools. I didn't have a problem and I have used this many times and the bits are still just as sharp as brand new. I used the drummer diamond tip bit for my tools, but I also tried the bits that came with and they work good too. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to protect their handtools from getting taken.
customer_reviews.author: WhitetailHunter23

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur engraver now. Very loud, wear headphones and pump up the bass. Your hand will hurt after about 10 minutes, I'm still building up endurance, but I also need to relax my grip more. Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: holyMOLy

customer_reviews.title: Decent price and quality
customer_reviews.text: It's very loud and hurts my ears, so I'm wearing ear protection. Decent price and quality. It makes me feel like I have to engrave everything now.
customer_reviews.author: Jayjay

customer_reviews.title: exellent impact engraver
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item, could control it quite easily. Worked well on metal (silver) and stone (several types).
customer_reviews.author: W. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It's nice quality, works well, comes with a few extra tips all packed in an odd but nice tube thing. It does the job. For the money ,you really can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan81

customer_reviews.title: Good Vibrations
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once since receiving it. However, it does a great job engraving and you have very good control using it free hand. It is comfortable to use. I do recommend this for light and medium engraving, especially free hand.
customer_reviews.author: Databoss

customer_reviews.title: Works good but man is it loud.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but loud. Sounds like a drill that old Dentist used on your fillings in the early 1980's with a the sound of a skill saw mixed in. It makes you want to hurry up and get that writing done.
customer_reviews.author: Debrina Maria

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for marking your tools
customer_reviews.text: I'm an apprentice electrician after having tools stolen and mysteriously vanishing got into the habit of engraving my initials and unique signature on EVERYTHING I can, and I mean everything I believe it makes a thief think twice about taking your tools.
customer_reviews.author: Estevan G.

customer_reviews.title: Engraves but
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for a thicker "line" for engraving ie names, designs etc-- this did not work for what I wanted- I tried it on various metals. I did keep it- it was a decent price so I'll experiment some more with it.
customer_reviews.author: orchid

customer_reviews.title: Will not engrave on granite!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this based on false information that it would engrave on granite, along with the diamond-tipped attachment. (This attachment on Amazon explicitly states it will work on granite.) Be aware this is not true. I called Dremel corporate, which confirmed this. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lang

customer_reviews.title: It is what it says it is
customer_reviews.text: It works for its desired purposes. But it is not as easy to use as it looks and sounds. Maybe its just me not having experience with it. A good pro is that it comes with many extras and it is very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Club

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool ! ! !  NOT TOO LOUD ! ! !
customer_reviews.text: Excellent engraving tool and I have owned my sharer over the years. As for the negative reviews on here about it being "too loud".....what exactly did you expect?.....you are using an engraving tool....... it has good power and speed settings ! ! !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, acessories not so much.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for engraving on a fiberglass boat. The included letter template wore out pretty quickly and the letters are really too small for the cutting tip. The tip barely fits into the openings and ruins the template quickly. A thin metal template would be much better. The engraver works fine, though. The variable speed adjustment really doesn't seem to make much difference in how it cuts. Maybe on some materials it would. Comes with extra tips and a long electric cord. Quite well made and easy to hold. Nice product at excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Oglesbee

customer_reviews.title: Clean, steady engraving
customer_reviews.text: SUPER easy to use. Makes steady, clean lines and writes like a pencil. I am very happy with my first attempts on practice material. Definitely wear eye protection to prevent dust from getting in your eyes, but otherwise it's nearly foolproof. (Works very well on stone)
customer_reviews.author: Lucy H. Harrow

customer_reviews.title: Worked on my work tools.
customer_reviews.text: Low cost way to keep coworkers away from pocketing my work tools. lol DOES WORK ON STEEL and even tool steel.
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: This item worked great for engraving my initials in a half a dozen ...
customer_reviews.text: This item worked great for engraving my initials in a half a dozen hand tools, but after just six items a connection shook loose or some other problem occurred and now is intermittently working. I was going to return this today but the return window ended yesterday.
customer_reviews.author: S. Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: Great for tools
customer_reviews.text: Great little engraver, worked even on hardened steels such as ratchets and sockets ( both chrome and impact), plastics, and non ferrous metals. Now all my stuff has my name so there's no misunderstandings, only theft now. :)
customer_reviews.author: DREWSASTER

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, excellent function. Best to remember to not turn it up too much - a little intensity does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: D. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice engraver
customer_reviews.text: Use it on anything you value or to identify keys and tools. Tons of uses and very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: morphine

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as my as seen on TV battery operated engraver
customer_reviews.author: MARIA

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas gift. Haven't tried yet, but once she does, I'll update. As big as pictured. All items look to be intact, looks to be got quality. Not to heavy in weight.
customer_reviews.author: Superwmn

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would do the job but you need a certain gift to make to look pretty. It is a good product but it is not easy as it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Priscila

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Engraved my name on over 300 tools with the tip that came with it and still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Quinonesgonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised good quality
customer_reviews.text: I use this to engrave a lot of different items of plastics and metals. I like it
customer_reviews.author: Clayton A. Tomlinson

customer_reviews.title: Decent etcher
customer_reviews.text: The etcher works like... an etcher. Easy enough to use. Not sure how valuable the included stencil is.
customer_reviews.author: JEFFREY

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Does the job and can't really complain because the price is pretty good. You get your money's worth
customer_reviews.author: Allece

customer_reviews.title: Negative review
customer_reviews.text: I used it for about 10 minutes and it broke down on me piece of garbage worst 25 bucks I ever spent I tried returning it to Amazon they said no you need to contact dremell I tried contacting dremell they said no you bought it from Amazon we cant do anything Worst communication everything over all was horrible and a waste of time
customer_reviews.author: Erik campos

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to see and took a long time for it to make a dent it in. Ended up ruining the thing I used it on
customer_reviews.author: Camille L

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed for this project!
customer_reviews.text: It fit comfortably in my hand which made the engraving process much easier and I was able to complete my entire project without feeling like I needed to rest my hand. It preformed just as the advertisement stated.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but the case for the extra nibs and wrench is not great. Always popping open and dropping the nibs in the tube the tool comes in.
customer_reviews.author: william c. settle

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job
customer_reviews.text: It engraves nicely on an Estwing hammer. Can't comment on it's durability as I haven't had it long but seems like quality construction. Minus 1 star because they could've kept the useless stencil.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Benson

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It's a Dremel, what else do you need to know.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Funk

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Works great for marking tools which can be difficult because of the hardness of the steel. Easy!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I had a cheaper engraver before that was hard to use and uncomfortable. This one is great.
customer_reviews.author: Karen  Gomez-Kling

customer_reviews.title: Much better than my old one
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Much better than the old piece of junk it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Dremel is a professional tool now
customer_reviews.text: From minor crafts to the serious craftsmen. I had a professional carpenter recommend the Saw-Max. A month later a the multi-tool was recommended and during the same conversation another person recommend the engraver. None of us would have discussed any of these tools in the years past. Dremel has made the jump and is now in professional craftsmen's tool boxes.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Dremel products are wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I like my Dremel engraver very much. It was definitely worth the price I paid and it was delivered to me very quickly. I am finding it difficult, however, to find a comfortable position for holding the tool for engraving. I imagine that will come easier with time and practice.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Dunton

customer_reviews.title: Future use
customer_reviews.text: Tried this. Need to professionally learn how to use it. I am sure this is a great investment
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: A great tool
customer_reviews.text: My grandson just received a lot of tools for his birthday. We bought the Dremel and rotary tool carving bits so he can mark his tools. He's happy
customer_reviews.author: Nangs

customer_reviews.title: Not so great to etch plexiglass
customer_reviews.text: Bought to etch plexiglass. It worked but would take too long to get the job done, multiple passes.
customer_reviews.author: buyerbennett

customer_reviews.title: Husband marks tools with this.
customer_reviews.text: He needed a new one to mark his tools. It works fine and he is very happy with it. That's all I know about it.
customer_reviews.author: Musicbird

customer_reviews.title: Awesome engraver
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the fact that it came with additional bits, a small tool to replace the bits and a stencil for letters and numbers. Feels really good in the hand however it is a bit loud but I guess that's to be expected. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Worth the 20$
customer_reviews.text: Worked as I figured, used it to etch my initials and last 4 of my social on my tools for proof in the event they are stolen again... Well worth the 20$
customer_reviews.author: Rawdiesel

customer_reviews.title: Hold vertical...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, you need to hold this perpendicular to your, whatever, otherwise it doesn't hammer well
customer_reviews.author: Cache

customer_reviews.title: Dremel always a good product
customer_reviews.text: My tools are easy to identify in our busy shop, and get returned to my box now, if I lend them out.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Great engraver for tools!!
customer_reviews.text: Engraves like a champ!! I have all new tools and needed to engrave my initials on them. Very smooth and cuts well. Works good on metal, plastic and wood.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lessnick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well especially like the templates to make neat consistent engravings
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Great little compressor, real quite and light weight to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Gunter

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I use it to engrave my initials on my tools at work and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have tool.
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have tool for everyone. It is a Dremel and this little tool lives up to it's name. I have marked and catalogued almost everything in the house. It comes with enough extra engraving tips to last a lifetime. Works on any surface.
customer_reviews.author: James Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Not that great for etching glass
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to etch glass, but honestly wasn't what i was expecting. For easy glass etching I suggest something like Armor Etch Cream.
customer_reviews.author: Madan Soundar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Using this to ID all my equipment. Handled my signature nicely. This should do the job.
customer_reviews.author: victor l.

customer_reviews.title: User friendly
customer_reviews.text: Great quality used to label all my tools for my job extreme simple to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Huerta

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Liked Dremel tools for a long time now and this continues the streak.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron  Yarbrough

customer_reviews.title: Nice engraver
customer_reviews.text: Got this to put my name on my tools -- works as advertised. Very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Erskine

customer_reviews.title: Keep engraved material in mind
customer_reviews.text: This only works well for very hard surfaces, so as long as your material isn’t rubber or anything like that, this will work well for you.
customer_reviews.author: M. Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice! it engraves smoothly, get the diamond point bit though. It is worth the couple extra bucks
customer_reviews.author: NikCali

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, works on hardened steels, rapid vibration makes penmanship a bit tricky (for me).
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel Flecker

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable tool
customer_reviews.text: being used for applications that were not originally intended for. good product
customer_reviews.author: CUSTODIAN 113

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Engraved most of my hand tools. Works good for what I needed. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: cd

customer_reviews.title: I thought it would be better than my old Dremel engraver
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be better than my old Dremel engraver, but it vibrates too much. Can't turn it down low enough. I engrave sterling silver, brass and copper.
customer_reviews.author: Pegi Pike

customer_reviews.title: Great for diy crafts
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to use. Slightly awkward to hold for tiny projects. Works well on glass. Etched about 24 mason jars with this for my bridal party drinking glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Good Engraver
customer_reviews.text: I use this engraver to label my tools and it works fine for that.
customer_reviews.author: tartakd

customer_reviews.title: Protect your property!
customer_reviews.text: After a recent burglary, I picked up this great little tool and engraved every piece of electronics and tools I own. It was a breeze to use and did the job on every type of materiel.
customer_reviews.author: Bronnie

customer_reviews.title: Works great for tools..
customer_reviews.text: I use this to write my name on all my tools.. it works great..
customer_reviews.author: TapSnapOrNap203

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband's birthday. When he opened it, the stencil and bit case were missing.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna N.

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: This little guy gets the job done; I would buy this again / Dremel 290-05.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for small applications.
customer_reviews.text: Scribes well, which is what I needed for my tools. Can write very small, like on the narrow edge of a craftsman 1/2 box end wrench. They are about 1/8” wide.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hellams

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: While I was impressed with the fast shipping, I have been overall disappointed with this product, simple put I expected better quality from a brand name like dremel that had been around as long as it has
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: For what it does, it works fine. It's an inexpensive way to carve into wood. It's not going to blast the wood away and you're going to have some work. It's a bit underpowered and the bits are small but for the price it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dave F

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Given as a gift for a student who does alot of woodwork!
customer_reviews.author: Pito

customer_reviews.title: Great engraver
customer_reviews.text: For months now, it's been grinding through padlocks putting serial numbers. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Jackson

product_meta.title: Dremel 290-05 120-Volt Engraver Rotary Tool with Stencils - Crafting Tool Perfect for DIY Personalizing and Engraving Leather, Metal, Glass, and Wood
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Dremel 290-05 is ideal for identifying and personalizing your valuables as well as decorative engraving, Engraves wood, leather, tools, machinery, hard steel, stone, glass, ceramics, porcelain, plastics and more, 115-Volt, AC, 60 Hz, 0.2-Amp, 7200 strokes per minute.

Note: The 290-05 kit contains the 290-01 tool + additional accessories.
feature_bullets: Dremel Engraver is ideal for personalizing your valuables as well as decorative designs
Kit includes five 9924 carbide points and letter/number stencil template ideal for decorative engraving and personalization
Engraves wood, leather, tools, machinery, hard steel, stone, glass, ceramics, porcelain, plastics and more
Soft grip body & lightweight design for added comfort during continuous use.
Kit includes four 9924 carbide point and letter/number stencil template ideal for decorative engraving and personalization
Optional 9929 diamond point (not included) for heavy-duty use on hard surfaces
2 YEAR TOOL WARRANTY & USA-BASED CUSTOMER SERVICE – Available by chat, email, phone or visit us at our service center in Racine, WI.
Five-position adjustable dial regulates engraving depth to achieve various strokes, from fine lines to deep grooves. Powered by 7,200 stroke per minute motor.
